tool.name: @BINARY@
tool.command:
ln -s '$matrix_h5_cooler' 'matrix.$matrix_h5_cooler.ext' && @BINARY@
--matrix 'matrix.$matrix_h5_cooler.ext'
#if $proteinFile: --proteinFile $proteinFile #end if
#if $maximumNumberOfLoops: --maximumNumberOfLoops $maximumNumberOfLoops #end if
#if $resolution: --resolution $resolution #end if
#if $runs: --runs $runs #end if
--outFileName hyperopt_result.txt
--threads @THREADS@

param.label: Protein peak file in bed format
param.help: The protein file to validate the detected loops.

param.label: Maximum number of loops
param.help: The maximum number of loops that should be used for optimization computation.

param.label: Resolution of the matrix
param.help: The matrix resolution of the Hi-C interaction matrix.

param.label: Hyperopt runs
param.help: The number of iterations hyperopt uses to search for a result

tool.help:
Hyperopt parameter optimization loop detection ==============================================
Compute with a protein peak data file (bed format) optimal parameters for the loop calling. Useful proteins are e.g. CTCF or cohesin.
_________________
Usage -----
A command line example is available below (easily matchable in Galaxy using each field information):
Ì€`$ hicHyperoptDetectLoops -m matrix.cool -o hyperopt_result.txt --maximumNumberOfLoops 10000 --resolution 10000 --runs 100`
